result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond K. Hamm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office. Per Judge Counsell's instructions  the following statement was to be included in this Judgment of Conviction,"Defendant was  given the benefit of doubt when the Court did not assess a jail sentence at this time and should not be given the same benefit if probation is revoked."

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.
Defendant shall Complete Domestic Violence Counseling and attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. 

 Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  
The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent .

The defendant shall have no contact with A.H. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way. Third party contact may be had to arrange and facilitate child custody as long as it is in compliance with any Family Court order. (Defendant is to follow which ever set of rules- either this order or Family Court orders-that are the most restrictive in regards to contact )

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition
